item.title: [PI] Urgent Dungeoneering key help REP++
item.dc:creator: @collin123456 collin123456
item.description:
@collin123456 wrote:

sageofmali:

Why do you have a for statement with no “i”? I mean you aren’t calling it in the methods anywhere. Try removing "for(int i…{"and the bracket that closes it “}”

are you talking about like:

Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, Key1, getRandX(), getRandY(), 1, c.playerId); //just once? 
Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, 18201, getRandX(), getRandY(), 1000, c.playerId);

i tried that already and it did the same things

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Urgent Dungeoneering key help REP++
item.dc:creator: @collin123456 collin123456
item.description:
@collin123456 wrote:

[quote=“sageofmali, post:2, topic:424477”][quote author=collin123456 link=topic=527133.msg3841670#msg3841670 date=1323295330]
i have this for(int i = 0; i < 1; i++) { Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, Key1, getRandX(), getRandY(), 1, c.playerId); //just once? Server.itemHandler.createGroundItem(c, 18201, getRandX(), getRandY(), 1000, c.playerId); }
i want it to spawn those only once, but it spawns 33 different piles, does anybody know wtf is wrong?
[/quote]
Show your getRandX() and getRandY() methods.[/quote]

public static int getRandX() {
	int[] randX = new int[] { 3236, 3229, 3235, 3234, 3227, 3228, 3233 };
	return randX[(int) Math.floor(Math.random() * randX.length)];
	}
	public static int getRandY() {
	int[] randY = new int[] { 9313, 9316, 9319, 9312, 9310, 9320, 9314 };
	return randY[(int) Math.floor(Math.random() * randY.length)];
	}

Read full topic
